headline: DuPont secures 10-year US import ban on China's Dawnsens in Tyvek case
summary: The International Trade Commission approved Dawnsens', also known as Dangs, voluntary agreement to the consent order.  The ban, effective immediately, follows DuPont's complaint in 2024 that Dangs misappropriated trade secrets and infringed trademarks linked to Tyvek, a synthetic material widely used in protective garments and packaging.

content.title: DuPont secures 10-year US import ban on China's Dawnsens in Tyvek case
content.summary: The International Trade Commission approved Dawnsens', also known as Dangs, voluntary agreement to the consent order.  The ban, effective immediately, follows DuPont's complaint in 2024 that Dangs misappropriated trade secrets and infringed trademarks linked to Tyvek, a synthetic material widely used in protective garments and packaging.

thumbnail.caption: A logo is pictured outside of Dupont offices in Geneva

headline: Dawnsens New-Materials Co. Voluntarily Consents to Order Prohibiting the Importation of Flashspun Nonwoven Materials into the United States
summary: DuPont (NYSE:DD) today announced that the International Trade Commission (ITC) approved Dawnsens New-Materials Co. ("Dangs") voluntary agreement to a consent order which excludes Dangs from selling and importing into the United States all accused materials and products containing such materials for a period of 10 years. This decision concludes DuPont's litigation against Dangs at the ITC for the misappropriation of trade secrets related to DuPont's Tyvek® products.

content.title: Dawnsens New-Materials Co. Voluntarily Consents to Order Prohibiting the Importation of Flashspun Nonwoven Materials into the United States
